Administration.text:
Type:
Anticholinergic
Dosage Forms: TAB 0.125mg; SL TAB: 0.125mg; INJ: 0.5 mg/mL; Drops 0.125 mg/mL
Routes of Administration: Oral, sublingual, IM/IV
Common Trade Names: Levsin

GI_Tract_spasm.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Bladder_spasm.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

IBS,_adjunct_tx.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

PUD,_adjunct_tx.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Parkinson's_disease,_adjunct_tx.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Biliary_colic,_adjunct_tx.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Renal_colic,_adjunct_tx.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Rhinitis.text:
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn
Max: 1.5 mg/day

Cholinesterase_overdose.text: Give 0.3-0.6 mg IV for each 0.5-2 mg neostigmine or physostigmine

Colic,_infantile.text:
<2 yo, 3.4-4.9 kg
4 drops PO q4h prn
<2 yo, 5-6.9 kg
5 drops PO q4h prn
<2 yo, 7-9.9 kg
6 drops PO q4h prn
<2 yo, >10 kg
8 drops PO q4h prn

Bladder_or_GI_Tract_spasm.text:
2-11 yo
0.0625-0.125 mg PO/SL q4h prn
12+ yo
0.125-0.25 mg PO/SL q4h prn

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk: Caution advised

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: Caution advised
Pediatric: Caution advised

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Caution advised
Pediatric: Caution advised

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Glaucoma
GI obstruction or ileus
Intestinal atony in elderly pts
Ulcerative colitis
Obstructive uropathy
Prostatic hypertrophy
MI
Unstable cardiovascular status
Autonomic neuropathy
Toxic megacolon
Myasthenia gravis

Serious.text:
Anaphylaxis
Heat stroke
IOP increase
Psychosis
, anticholinergic
Hallucinations

Common.text:
Xerostermia
Dry eyes, blurred vision, mydriasis, cycloplegia
Urinary retention,
constipation
,
nausea
,
vomiting
Confusion, impaired memory, excitement, nervousness
Tachycardia
,
palpitations
Anhidrosis, flushing
Loss of taste
Headache
,
Dizziness
Ataxia
Drowsiness, weakness, insomnia
Fever
Impotence, lactation suppression
Urticaria

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2-3.5 hr (7.5 hr ER form)
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: Urine primarily (30-50% unchanged)
